TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE .
He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
A.

The applicant was arrested on DATE and detained on DATE under suspicion of complicity in a murder . On DATE he was charged , inter alia , with murder before ORG ( kihlakunnanoikeus , häradsrätt ) . He was accused of committing the murder of L together with PERSON The charge had already been brought against K on DATE and there had been CARDINAL previous hearings in the case . In these hearings CARDINAL witnesses had given evidence in ORG presence .
The applicant and K , who both had been on the scene of crime , denied having shot L and accused one another .

In the CARDINAL hearings that followed the applicant 's apprehension , ORG heard evidence from the CARDINAL accused and from CARDINAL of the previously heard and CARDINAL new witnesses , some of whom were called by the applicant .
In the hearing on DATE the applicant 's legal counsel stated that witnesses should be examined in the presence of the accused and the accused should be allowed to put questions to witnesses .

In the hearing on DATE ORG called CARDINAL witnesses LAW and GPE , among others . ORG was the victim 's girlfriend and GPE an acquaintance of the accused . ORG requested evidence from these witnesses to be heard in the absence of the applicant and PERSON They had already given evidence in ORG presence in the previous hearings . No objection from the applicant 's part was entered in the record . Under LAW , LAW , LAW , of LAW ( oikeudenkäymiskaari , rättegångsbalken , see below ) ORG accepted ORG request . The applicant 's legal counsel examined the witnesses . After the testimonies were given , the presiding judge summarised them to the applicant and K , who were then allowed to put further questions to the witnesses .

In the hearing on DATE the ORG heard testimony from ORG , an acquaintance of the applicant and K , in their absence . ORG had earlier given evidence in ORG presence . The applicant 's legal counsel was able to examine the witness . When asked after the testimony , the applicant did not have further questions to ORG . The witness GPE gave testimony anew , this time in the presence of the applicant and ORG also heard testimony from ORG , who had already given evidence in the hearing on DATE . This time ORG requested ORG to be examined without the applicant and ORG presence , but the request was rejected . However , during ORG 's evidence the applicant and K were removed from the courtroom , as ORG got the impression that the witness failed to tell what he knew when the accused were present . The applicant 's legal counsel continued to examine the witness . After ORG 's testimony , the presiding judge summarised it briefly to the applicant and K , who were then allowed to put further questions .
Other witnesses ' testimonies before ORG were heard in the presence of the applicant and PERSON

On DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of murder and other offences and sentenced him to life imprisonment . It based the judgement on the testimonies of the CARDINAL accused and the witnesses . When evaluating the testimony of the applicant , ORG took into consideration that the applicant had had the opportunity to follow the news reports of the proceedings prior to his arrest .

Immediately after the pronouncement of ORG judgment , the applicant gave notice of his intention to appeal and asked for a copy of the reasons of the judgment . On DATE ORG informed the applicant 's legal counsel that a copy of ORG record , including the judgment , could be fetched after TIME On DATE the applicant requested DATE extension of time for appeal . ORG rejected the request on DATE . The time for appeal expired on DATE .

The applicant appealed against the judgment of DATE and the decision of DATE to ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätt ) . On DATE , ORG rejected the appeals . As regards the murder charge , it stated : ( translation from NORP ) “ There is no reason to change ORG judgment . ”
On DATE , ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) refused the applicant leave to appeal .
B. Relevant domestic law
The relevant domestic law as in force at the relevant time :

According to LAW , Subsection CARDINAL , of the Code of Judicial Procedure , the court may decide to hear a witness in the absence of a party , if the witness for fear of the party or for some other reason fails to tell what he knows about the matter , or if the party interferes with the witness 's testimony or tries to confuse the witness . The testimony must be read to the absent party and he must be allowed to put further questions to the witness .

According to LAW , Section CARDINAL , of the Code of ORG procedure , a party who wishes to appeal against a ORG judgment must give notice of his intention to appeal within DATE from the pronouncement of the judgment . Section CARDINAL , Subsection CARDINAL , of the LAW provides that the time - limit for filing an appeal is DATE from DATE the judgment was pronounced .

According to Chapter CARDINAL , Section CARDINALa , Subsection CARDINAL , of the Code of Judicial Procedure , a copy of a ORG judgment must be available to a party who has given notice of his intention to appeal within DATE from the pronouncement of the judgment in the registry of ORG .

According to LAW , Section CARDINAL , Subsection CARDINAL , of the Code of Judicial Procedure , if a party , who has given notice of his intention to appeal , can not appeal within the time set due to a legal impediment or some other acceptable reason , ORG may set a new time limit for appeal .

According to Chapter CARDINAL , Section CARDINAL , of the Code of Judicial Procedure , an appellate court must not repeat the reasons of the lower court 's decision when upholding the decision . When further reasons are found , they may be added .
